intro: Paradina hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy paradina, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Paradina hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
